comment: Very nice person, welcomes and encourages class participation and questions. Very clear and straightforward syllabus. Options to drop quizzes altogether or substitutue quiz average for lowest test score. Tests are very tricky. Offers study guides. High use of book. Very knowledgeable guy.

Good prof, good syllabus, posts outlines, sample exam q's & a's.  Tests almost all on textbook material; lectures review, reinforce, and answer questions.  Prof gives good explanations and welcomes questions.

The subject is hard, and he helps a lot in your understanding. The textbook is very important in this course. Therefore, make sure you read related chapters (including end of each chapter) and understand the concepts. His voice is low, so, make sure you sit close to him. Overall, a very nice and helpful professor. Strongly recommend him.

Subject is not an easy subject, but goes out of his way to help you understand. I feel like I learned so much in this class and would recommend him for this class. Have to study a lot to fully uderstand.

This class is hard, if you struggle with this topic, like me. He is helpful and will meet with you. However, it is hard for him to break it down further than what the book does. VERY smart. He can be boring at times with just lecture. Puts the notes online, but you have to go to class to understand!
Very helpful professor, he knows his material and is always available to help students.

The material is difficult and he talks in circles. Very nice guy and wants to help, but he doesn't know how. He knows his stuff but can't relay it to the class. 4 exams counting the final. Tests are either all multiple choice, part mult. choice part essay or all essay. Always available for extra help, which will be needed.
I would not recommend him. Got a good grade in the class but it is VERY boring and taught myself a lot of it.

TERRIBLE! Required that you read the text prior to class (nothing wrong with that), however, in class all he did is simply repeat, nearly verbatim, the reading.  Added NO insight or experience to material and thus added nothing to the class.  Could have just read the book at home and learned just as much.

The professor is extremely intelligent and will go to any length to help students. I would suggest to not buy the book and just purchase the study guide - the book is useless. He is VERY specific on tests, but is open to discussing bad questions, etc. Overall good prof and would take again.

Good teacher, he is clearly passionate about his teaching, the content isn't very exciting but if you read the book and listen to the lectures you should alright. The only grades all semeseter were 4 tests!

Professor Sabbarese is a good teacher, but his classes are really hard.  You can choose what kind of test to take, but he's not lenient about his questions at all.  It took our class 30 min. for him to consider throwing out one question because he told us differently during the review.  Easy "A" Certainly NOT! Easy "D" this class is for you.

Very intelligent.  Like a PhD, likes to do proofs.  Just read the book, attend class (has quizzes), and don't get bogged down in the tangents.  If you stay focused on the end formulas and how to "plug-n-chug", you'll do fine.

This isn't a class to coast through and he knows that. If you really study and read the books and materials to understand it and do the supplemental problems, it shouldn't be too bad. He is very helpful though and you can tell that he wants the students to do well and learn.

Smart & knows what he is talking about. Attendance is not req there r only 3 test. He has lots of pp & no hw. He is not a bad teacher & learning ability depends on the student. I learned better at home reading off the companion website. haven't finished class yet but am doin well would recom. if u have some disipline. oh, teaches till time to go.

Somewhat unorganized but he is very slack when it comes to grading.  You have a choice of what kind of test to take (multiple choice, essay, or both) so do the multiple choice. Buy the book and read the main theme points. Don't just try to learn from lectures, this is college people.
Good guy.  Always enjoyed his lectures.  Got alot from the two classes i took with him.
He is a nice guy but he is a very unorganized professor & the textbook sucks.  The book is full of conceptual & mathematical errors.  He requires a group paper & presentation and lots of homework.
